org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.jdbc

Class JdbcProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.jdbc.JdbcProperties

  • public class JdbcProperties
extends Object
    This class specifies properties specific to a JDBC Processor, independent on the underlying database connection technology (e.g. pooled / direct, JNDI, data source, ...).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JdbcProperties()
      Constructs an empty set of JDBC properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property).
      JdbcProperties(JdbcProperties properties)
      Creates a set of JDBC properties from an existing set of JDBC properties, making a defensive copy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JdbcProperties

        public JdbcProperties()
        Constructs an empty set of JDBC properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property). Usually this constructor is used if this configuration POJO is populated in an automated fashion (e.g. injection). If you need to build them manually (possibly with defaults), use or create a properties builder.

        You can change the defaults with the setters.

        See Also:
        MapBasedCommonPropsBuilder, MapBasedCommonPropsBuilder

      • JdbcProperties

        public JdbcProperties(JdbcProperties properties)
        Creates a set of JDBC properties from an existing set of JDBC properties, making a defensive copy.
        Parameters:
        properties - The set of properties to copy
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When properties is null
        See Also:
        ()

      • getEventIdFieldName

        public final String getEventIdFieldName()
        Returns:
        the name of the field holding a unique event ID
        See Also:
        setEventIdFieldName(String)

      • setEventIdFieldName

        public final void setEventIdFieldName(String eventIdFieldName)
        The name of the field in the event that holds a unique event ID.

        This event ID can be created e.g. with the `org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.eventid.EventIdProcessor` processor.

        Note that the field (referenced in the INSERT SQL statements both for the events table and the search table) that holds this value must be long enough to accept a value of the maximum length possible for the value configured here.

        Parameters:
        eventIdFieldName - the length of the (random) event ID generated by this processor (must be greater 0)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the eventIdFieldName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the eventIdFieldName is empty

      • getIndexedFields

        public final String getIndexedFields()
        Returns:
        The event fields to be added to the search / index table. May be null or empty if no fields have been configured
        See Also:
        setIndexedFields(String)

      • setIndexedFields

        public final void setIndexedFields(String indexedFields)
        Set the fields to be added to the search / index table.

        Provide a list of fields that is separated with the separation character specified in setIndexedFieldSeparator(java.lang.String). Define a mapping of Event field names to search index field names (i.e. keys / names under which the provided Event field will be stored in the index table) as shown in the example below, using the character specified in the setIndexedFieldNameSeparator(java.lang.String).

        Note that the mapping of an event field name to an search index field name is optional. If no indexed field names separator is used for a specific field, then the event field name is used to store the field in the search table.

        Set this to null or empty if none of the event fields should be included in the search table.

        This example uses , as the indexed fields separator, and : as the indexed field names separator.

        Example: eventActor:indexedActor,eventSubject,eventObject:indexedObject

        Parameters:
        indexedFields - The list of fields to be included in the search table / index

      • getIndexedFieldsMaxLength

        public final int getIndexedFieldsMaxLength()
        Returns:
        the maximum length of an indexed event field to be persisted to the indexed fields database table
        See Also:
        setIndexedFieldsMaxLength(int)

      • setIndexedFieldsMaxLength

        public final void setIndexedFieldsMaxLength(int indexedFieldsMaxLength)
        The maximum length of the values to be stored in indexed fields.

        If the value of a specific indexed field in an event is longer than this setting, then the value of the field is truncated to this length before it is inserted in the indexed fields table.

        Parameters:
        indexedFieldsMaxLength - the maximum length of the values to be stored in indexed fields (must be greater 0)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the provided value of indexedFieldsMaxLength is out of range

      • isIndexedFieldsToLower

        public final boolean isIndexedFieldsToLower()
        Returns:
        whether an indexed event field should be converted to lowercase before being stored in the database
        See Also:
        setIndexedFieldsToLower(boolean)

      • setIndexedFieldsToLower

        public final void setIndexedFieldsToLower(boolean indexedFieldsToLower)
        Whether to convert all characters in indexed fields to lowercase before they are stored in the indexed fields database table.

        Set this to `true` when using a database that only supports case-sensitive search, or if the case-insensitive search on the database is not as performant as the case-sensitive search.

        Parameters:
        indexedFieldsToLower - whether to convert all characters in indexed fields to lowercase

      • getInsertIndexedFieldSqlStmt

        public final String getInsertIndexedFieldSqlStmt()
        Returns:
        The indexed field SQL "INSERT" statement (search / indextable)
        See Also:
        setInsertIndexedFieldSqlStmt(String)

        Set the SQL statement to insert event records in the search / index table.
        Parameters:
        insertIndexedFieldSqlStmt - The SQL statement used to insert indexed audit fields to the database
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the insertIndexedFieldSqlStmt is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the insertIndexedFieldSqlStmt is empty

      • getIndexedFieldSeparator

        public final String getIndexedFieldSeparator()
        Returns:
        The indexed field separator
        See Also:
        setIndexedFieldSeparator(String)

      • setIndexedFieldSeparator

        public final void setIndexedFieldSeparator(String indexedFieldSeparator)
        Set the indexed fields separator character used in setIndexedFields(String).

        The length of this parameter must be equal to 1.

        Parameters:
        indexedFieldSeparator - The character used to separate fields
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the mdcFieldSeparator is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the mdcFieldSeparator is empty or its length is not 1

      • getIndexedFieldNameSeparator

        public final String getIndexedFieldNameSeparator()
        Returns:
        The indexed field name separator
        See Also:
        setIndexedFieldNameSeparator(String)

      • setIndexedFieldNameSeparator

        public final void setIndexedFieldNameSeparator(String indexedFieldNameSeparator)
        Set the field name separator character used in setIndexedFields(String)} to separate field names in the search / index table from the event field name. This allows using a different field name in the index / search table than in the event.

        The length of this parameter must be equal to 1.

        Parameters:
        indexedFieldNameSeparator - The character used to separate field names in the search / index table from the event field name
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the mdcFieldSeparator is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the mdcFieldSeparator is empty or its length is not 1

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        The name of the data source attribute in the ProcessingObjects of the AbstractJdbcProcessor.process(org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.Event, String, org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.ProcessingObjects) method (when connecting through a data source that is provided by the integrating application).
        Parameters:
        dataSourceName - the name of the data source attribute
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the jndiConnectionName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the jndiConnectionName is empty

      • getAdditionalProperties

        public final Map<String,String> getAdditionalProperties()
        Returns:
        Any additional properties stored in this object that have not explicitly been parsed
        See Also:
        setAdditionalProperties(Map)

      • setAdditionalProperties

        public final void setAdditionalProperties(Map<String,String> additionalProperties)
        Any additional properties which have not been parsed, and for which no getter/setter exists, but are to be stored in this object nevertheless.

        This property is commonly used to preserve original properties from upstream components that are to be passed on to downstream components unchanged. This properties set may or may not include properties that have been extracted from the map, and been made available through this POJO.

        Note that these additional properties may be null or empty, even in a fully populated POJO where other properties commonly have values assigned to.

        Parameters:
        additionalProperties - The additional properties to store
